summary:
With a previous background as HR professional, I developed more than 15 years experiences working across various countries and roles prior turning my career into training & coaching. As a certified trainer, facilitator and coach, I am passionate about and fully dedicated to enhance the development of Leadership & HR skills for teams, people and organizations.

Currently settled in Netherlands, I am familiar with changing and multicultural environments, having lived and worked in various countries (USA, Europe, Africa, Middle East, Asia), in charge of or accompanying locally based teams.

projects:
[{'title': 'Training on Team Building for the Mid-Level Management of MADERA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': "MADERA operates in Afghanistan with a special focus on livestock, animal health, agriculture, and horticulture (find more about MADERA here: www.madera-asso.org). Enterprise development through community involvement approach is an specialty of MADERA. The organization inherited a challenge from everyday Afghanistan: Lack of cohesion among the employees from different ethnicity.

MADERA, like many other international NGOs operating in Afghanistan, encourages ethnic diversity in workplace. This, in turn, also created a big challenge as its workforce included people for different ethic groups e.g. Hazara, Pashtun, Tajik, Uzbek. To bring cohesion among stakeholders and employees in order to develop a conducive work environment, MADERA requested BRAC Afghanistan that could address the intra- as well as inter-organization diversity challenge.

I, under the direct supervision of the Program Manager of BRAC Afghanistan's Training Division, was assigned with conducting the training needs assessment, maintaining peer-level correspondence at MADERA, developing the training modules and resources, and overseeing the translation of the resources for this training intervention. A citizen of a largely homogeneous country in terms of culture and language, my hands on experience from this intervention was priceless.

During the preparation stage as well as the actual conduction of the training, I got extensive support in developing the training curriculum and resources from Mr Chowdhury and Ms. Kaakar. Ms. Kaakar was very much instrumental in facilitating the training sessions in Dari and Pashto. The translation of this training materials in Dari and Pashto would not have been possible if Ms. Kaakar did not go her extra mile for me.

", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Adeline', 'last_name': 'Gourdon', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Coach & Trainer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Khandaker Fokhrul', 'last_name': 'Alam', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of Resource Mobilisation & New Business Development at BRAC'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lailuma', 'last_name': 'Kaakar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of Management at BRAC, Afghanistan'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Kamrul Hasan', 'last_name': 'Chowdhury', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head Of Learning Development (Soft Skills Trainings) HR & LD BRAC at BRAC'}]}]
